info.name: Simplesat API (v1)
info.description:
Welcome to the Simplesat API reference!

The public endpoints are stable but still a work in progress. If you have any questions or see any issues, please reach out to us at [support@simplesat.io](https://mailto:support@simplesat.io).

# Authentication

You need a Simplesat account with an API key to make requests. To find your key, log into your Simplesat account and head over to **Admin** > **Account Settings**.

To authenticate, use the API key in a `X-Simplesat-Token` header.

| Key | Value |
| --- | --- |
| X-Simplesat-Token | Your access token |

# Pagination

By default, most list endpoints return a maximum of 100 records per page. You can change the number of records on a per-request basis by passing a `page_size` parameter in the request URL parameters. Example: `page_size=50`.

When the response exceeds the per-page maximum, you can paginate through the records by incrementing the page parameter. Example: `page=3`. List results include `next` and `previous` URLs in the response body for easier navigation:

```
{
    "answers": [...],
    "count": 106,
    "next": "https://api.simplesat.io/api/v1/questions?page=2",
    "previous": null,
}

 ```

Stop paging when the `next` attribute is `null`.

item.name: Answers

response.name: Get an answer
response.body:
{
    "id": 11060778,
    "choice": "3",
    "choice_label": "Okay, but not great.",
    "sentiment": "Neutral",
    "comment": null,
    "follow_up_answer": "Great service, but response time could have been a bit faster.",
    "follow_up_answer_choice": null,
    "follow_up_question": null,
    "published_as_testimonial": false,
    "created": "2021-12-13T10:42:39.410573Z",
    "modified": "2021-12-13T10:42:39.410608Z",
    "question": {
        "id": 44993,
        "text": "How did we do?",
        "metric": "csat"
    },
    "survey": {
        "id": 16738,
        "name": "CSAT survey"
    },
    "response_id": 6134350
}

request.description:
Retrieve answers by applying specific filters in the request body. If the request body is left empty, the API will return all answers from the last 30 days by default. Including only a `start_date` field will yield answers from the date specified up to 30 days prior. ## Request fields | **Attribute** | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | start_date | datetime | The date and time in ISO 8601 format to start displaying answers. | | end_date | datetime | The date and time in ISO 8601 format to end displaying answers. | | operator | string | `"and"` - all filters must match.
`"or"` - at least one filter must match. | | filters | array of objects | Includes one or more `key`/`values` pairs to use as filters. | | key | string | The field name to filter (see all available fields in the table below). | | attribute | string | Use to define the field name for nested customer, ticket, or team member custom attributes. See below for how to find custom attribute field names. | | values | array | The value or values for the `key` field. Single values still must be wrapped in brackets. Separate multiple values by a comma within the brackets.

Example: `"values": ["tester@example.com"]` | | comparison | string | Supports: `is`, `is_not`, `contains`, `does_not_contain`, `is_unknown`, `has_any_value`.

The `is_unknown` and `has_any_value` comparisons still require a value to be present in the filter, but the value is ignored. So for example, you could just use `"values": ["-"]`. | ## Key fields | **Attribute** | **Value type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | choice_value | integer | Also referred to as "rating value". | | collaborator | string | The email address of a team member associated with a response (in Simplesat, "collaborators" are team members associated with responses, while the "team_member" field is the primary collaborator). | | company | string | Company name. | | comment | string | Use the `has_any_value` comparison to search for responses or answers containing a comment. | | customer | string | Customer full name. | | customer.email | string | Customer email. | | ip | string | Use the `contains` comparison as most feedback are associated with multiple IP addresses. | | metric | string | Available options: `NPS`, `CES`, `CSAT`, `5-STAR`. | | sentiment | string | Available options: `positive`, `neutral`, `negative` | | source | string | `is` and `is_not` comparisons expect the source ID. Use `contains` to search by source name. | | survey | string | Expects a 43 character survey key found in rating URLs. | | survey_id | integer | Expects the survey ID which you can find through the API. | | tag | string | `is` and `is_not` comparisons expect the tag ID. Use `contains` to earch by tag name. | | team_member | string | Team member name. | | team_member.email | string | Team member email. | | team_member.id | string | Team member external ID. | | ticket_id | string | Ticket ID. | | customer.attributes | string | Add the `attribute` field to define the custom attribute key. | | ticket.attributes | string | Add the `attribute` field to define the custom attribute key. | ## Filtering with custom attributes Filtering by customer and ticket custom attributes is supported. To do so, enter `customer.attribute` or `ticket.attribute` as the `key`. Add the `attribute` field that includes the field name. _Example:_ ``` json "filters": [ { "key": "customer.attribute", "attribute": "upload_country", "values": ["United States"], "comparison": "is_not" } ] ``` Finding the correct attribute field name is currently a little tricky, as Simplesat appends prefixes to custom attributes depending on where they were created. To find the full attribute value: - Create a filter in the Simplesat dashboard that includes the field that you want to use. - Open the Network tab in developer tools. - Find the request named `?limit=20&offset=0`. - Click on the Payload tab. - From there, you should see the full field name. In the example below, the field displayed as `latest_nps` in the dashboard is `int_attribute_latest_nps`.

response.name: Search answers
response.body:
{
    "next": "https://api.simplesat.io/api/v1/answers/search/?page=2",
    "previous": null,
    "count": 218,
    "answers": [
        {
            "id": 24548190,
            "choice": null,
            "choice_label": null,
            "choices": null,
            "comment": "great!",
            "follow_up_answer": null,
            "follow_up_answer_choice": null,
            "follow_up_answer_choices": null,
            "published_as_testimonial": false,
            "created": "2023-08-30T15:11:28Z",
            "modified": "2023-08-30T15:11:28.434920Z",
            "question": {
                "id": 150284,
                "text": "Any other feedback on web-embed surveys?",
                "metric": "custom"
            },
            "sentiment": null,
            "survey": {
                "id": 111976,
                "name": "Web embed"
            },
            "response_id": 12922108
        }
    ]
}

response.name: Update an answer
response.body:
{
    "id": 1106178,
    "choice": "4",
    "choice_label": "Great, I'm satisfied.",
    "sentiment": "Positive",
    "comment": null,
    "follow_up_answer": "Everything was amazing!!!",
    "follow_up_answer_choice": null,
    "published_as_testimonial": false,
    "created": "2021-12-13T10:42:39.410573Z",
    "modified": "2021-12-23T13:26:58.927701Z",

item.description:
## Answer model

| **Attribute** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | Number |  |
| choice | String |  |
| choices | Array | Used for multi-select answers. |
| comment | String |  |
| follow_up_answer | String | Used when the answer is in the form of a comment. |
| follow_up_answer_choice | String | Used when the answer is from a multiple choice or sliding scale question type. |
| follow_up_answer_choices | Array | Used for multi-select follow-up answers. |
| modified | DateTime |  |
| created | DateTime |  |
| survey_id | Number |  |
| response_id | Number |  |

item.name: Customers
item.description:
## Customer model

| **Attribute** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | Number |  |
| external\_id | String |  |
| name | String |  |
| email | String |  |
| custom\_attributes | Object |  |
| tags | Array |  |

item.name: Questions

request.description:
## Query parameters

| **Parameter** | **Description** |
| --- | --- |
| metric | Filter questions by csat, nps, or ces. |
| survey\_id | Filter questions by a survey's ID. |

response.name: List questions

item.description:
## Question model

| **Attribute** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | Number |  |
| survey_id | Number |  |
| order | Number |  |
| metric | String |  |
| text | String |  |
| rating_scale | Boolean |  |
| required | Boolean |  |
| choices | Array |  |
| rules | Array |  |

## Rules model

| **Attribute** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| conditions | Array |  |
| action | String |  |
| question | Object |  |

item.name: Responses

request.description: Retrieve a single response by ID.

response.name: Get a response

request.description:
Retrieve responses by applying specific filters in the request body. If the request body is left empty, the API will return all responses from the last 30 days by default. Including only a `start_date` field will return all responses from the date specified up to 30 days after. ## Request fields | **Attribute** | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | start_date | datetime | The date and time in ISO 8601 format to start displaying responses. | | end_date | datetime | The date and time in ISO 8601 format to end displaying responses. | | operator | string | `"and"` - all filters must match.
`"or"` - at least one filter must match. | | filters | array of objects | Includes one or more `key`/`values` pairs to use as filters. | | key | string | The field name to filter (see all available fields in the table below). | | attribute | string | Use to define the field name for nested customer, ticket, or team member custom attributes. See below for how to find custom attribute field names. | | values | array | The value or values for the `key` field. Single values still must be wrapped in brackets. Separate multiple values by a comma within the brackets.

Example: `"values": ["tester@example.com"]` | | comparison | string | Supports: `is`, `is_not`, `contains`, `does_not_contain`, `is_unknown`, `has_any_value`.

The `is_unknown` and `has_any_value` comparisons still require a value to be present in the filter, but the value is ignored. So for example, you could just use `"values": ["-"]`. | ## Key fields | **Attribute** | **Value type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | choice_value | integer | Also referred to as "rating value". | | collaborator | string | The email address of a team member associated with a response (in Simplesat, "collaborators" are team members associated with responses, while the "team_member" field is the primary collaborator). | | company | string | Company name. | | comment | string | Use the `has_any_value` comparison to search for responses or answers containing a comment. | | customer | string | Customer full name. | | customer.email | string | Customer email. | | ip | string | Use the `contains` comparison as most feedback are associated with multiple IP addresses. | | metric | string | Available options: `NPS`, `CES`, `CSAT`, `5-STAR`. | | sentiment | string | Available options: `positive`, `neutral`, `negative` | | source | string | `is` and `is_not` comparisons expect the source ID. Use `contains` to search by source name. | | survey | string | Expects a 43 character survey key found in rating URLs. | | survey_id | integer | Expects the survey ID which you can find through the API. | | tag | string | `is` and `is_not` comparisons expect the tag ID. Use `contains` to earch by tag name. | | team_member | string | Team member name. | | team_member.email | string | Team member email. | | team_member.id | string | Team member external ID. | | ticket_id | string | Ticket ID. | | customer.attributes | string | Add the `attribute` field to define the custom attribute key. | | ticket.attributes | string | Add the `attribute` field to define the custom attribute key. | ## Filtering with custom attributes Filtering by customer and ticket custom attributes is supported. To do so, enter `customer.attribute` or `ticket.attribute` as the `key`. Add the `attribute` field that includes the field name. _Example:_ ``` json "filters": [ { "key": "customer.attribute", "attribute": "upload_country", "values": ["United States"], "comparison": "is_not" } ] ``` Finding the correct attribute field name is currently a little tricky, as Simplesat appends prefixes to custom attributes depending on where they were created. To find the full attribute value: - Create a filter in the Simplesat dashboard that includes the field that you want to use. - Open the Network tab in developer tools. - Find the request named `?limit=20&offset=0`. - Click on the Payload tab. - From there, you should see the full field name. In the example below, the field displayed as `latest_nps` in the dashboard is `int_attribute_latest_nps`.

item.description:
## Response model

| **Attribute** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | Number |  |
| created | DateTime |  |
| modified | DateTime |  |
| survey_id | Number |  |
| tags | Array |  |
| answers | Array | Array of the answer model |
| team_members | Array | Array of the team member model |
| ticket | Object | Object of the ticket model |
| customer_id | Number |  |

## Ticket model

| **Attribute** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | Number |  |
| external_id | String |  |
| subject | String |  |
| custom_attributes | Object |  |
